properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 4 at 12:59AM PST until January 4 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW THROUGH SATURDAY IN THE CASCADE MOUNTAINS...

.Several rounds of moderate to heavy snow will impact the Cascade
Crest this weekend into next week. Accumulations of 8 to
14 inches are expected at Stevens Pass through Saturday
afternoon. More heavy snow will be possible Sunday and Sunday
night and again Tuesday.

* WHAT...Snow expected for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2
between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Total snow
accumulations of 8 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55
mph producing patchy blowing snow.

* WHERE...Stehekin and Holden Village.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Treacherous driving conditions on Highway 2 from
Coles Corner to Stevens Pass. Patchy blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree
damage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of weather systems will bring
periods of moderate to heavy snow to the Cascades this weekend
into next week. If you have plans to travel over the Cascade
Passes the next several days, monitor road reports closely.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
